title: "More complete" Theo Walcott praised by Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger just before England rejection — on his birthday!
text:

Wide-man who turned 28 on Thursday has impressed his club manager more than he has the Three Lions' Gareth Southgate Share Wenger feels Walcott's had a point to prove after being overlooked for Euro 2016 (Photo: Arsenal FC/Getty) Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Theo Walcott has received a birthday pick-me-up from Arsene Wenger on the day he was dropped from the England squad. 
Party-pooper Gareth Southgate wiped the smile off Walcott's face as he celebrated turning 28 on Thursday, leaving the Arsenal forward out of his latest squad despite being short on firepower. 
The bad news came just hours after Wenger hailed birthday-boy Walcott 's development and claimed he has become a more complete and efficient player this season. 
And, ironically, Wenger pinpointed Walcott's omission from England's Euro 2016 squad as a big factor in his improved form this season. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch in full: Wenger's press conference ahead of WBA clash Share this video Watch Next 
Walcott has bagged 17 goals in 29 games for Arsenal this season, his best tally since he scored 21 times in the 2012-13 campaign. 
That form had not been enough to keep him in Southgate's plans for the games against Germany and Lithuania, but Wenger said: “He has become more of a complete player, more efficient. 
“He does better in the tactical part of his game and works hard defensively and offensively. He has been less injured as well, that helps. 
“He has turned up in big games as well, he can score goals in big games. He showed that against Bayern, he scored the goal and I think it was a penalty on him and he can influence games. Walcott is enjoying his best goal-scoring season for years (Photo: Getty) Read More "Nothing is good enough anymore" — Wenger hits out at his detractors 
“The major quality of Theo is the quality of his receptions – that means he gets the ball in areas where he is extremely dangerous and that is a very intelligent part of a football player.” 
Walcott revealed earlier this season that he worked hard physically and on his mentality since the end of last campaign. 
And after summer talks with Wenger, among “many people”, he vowed to make an impact this season and “repay” those who have shown faith in him during his up and down career. 
Wenger said: “He is a focused player and was not picked for the European Championship. Always in life you try and get to the next level when things don't go for you or you think you do everything right and continue to live like you did before – and he had the right response. 
“He said 'What do I need to do to get higher up?' and he did it.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
